title: How to Count to Twenty in Bengali

steps.title: One - Ek (এক)
steps.content: One - Ek (এক) . It sounds like ack! [1] X Research source

steps.title: Two - Du-i (দুই).
steps.content: Two - Du-i (দুই). Bangla has two different sounds for d. This is softer - do-ee. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Three - Tin (তিন).
steps.content: Three - Tin (তিন). Bangla has 3 different t sounds. This is a soft t - teen. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Four - Char (চার).
steps.content: Four - Char (চার). It's pronounced the way the English word 'char' is pronounced. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Five - Pa(n)ch (পাঁচ).
steps.content: Five - Pa(n)ch (পাঁচ). This has the nasal n sound that is used to pronounce some of the French words. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Six - Chhoy (ছয়).
steps.content: Six - Chhoy (ছয়). Bangla has two sounds for ch. One is the sound that's used to pronounce English words that start with ch, such as: church, child, etc. The other sound is softer. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Seven - Shaat (সাত).
steps.content: Seven - Shaat (সাত). Bangla has 3 different s sounds. This is the closest to sh. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Eight - Aat (আট).
steps.content: Eight - Aat (আট). It's pronounced like the English word 'art' without pronouncing the letter r. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Nine - Noy (নয়).
steps.content: Nine - Noy (নয়). It's pronunciation is similar to the English word 'boy'. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Ten - Dosh (দশ).
steps.content: Ten - Dosh (দশ). This word is pronounced with a soft d. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Eleven - Ey-ga-ro (এগারো).
steps.content: Eleven - Ey-ga-ro (এগারো). [11] X Research source

steps.title: Twelve - Ba-ro (বারো).
steps.content: Twelve - Ba-ro (বারো). [12] X Research source

steps.title: Thirteen - Te-ro (তেরো).
steps.content: Thirteen - Te-ro (তেরো). It's pronounced with a soft t. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Fourteen - Choud-do (চৌদ্দ).
steps.content: Fourteen - Choud-do (চৌদ্দ). The ch and the d are soft, here. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Fifteen - Po-ne-ro (পনেরো).
steps.content: Fifteen - Po-ne-ro (পনেরো). [15] X Research source

steps.title: Sixteen - Sho-lo (ষোলো).
steps.content: Sixteen - Sho-lo (ষোলো). [16] X Research source

steps.title: Seventeen - Sho-te-ro (সতেরো).
steps.content: Seventeen - Sho-te-ro (সতেরো). The t must be pronounced softly. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Eighteen - Aa-tha-ro (আঠারো).
steps.content: Eighteen - Aa-tha-ro (আঠারো). The th should sound like that is pronounced in the words turmeric, ten, etc. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Nineteen - U-nish (উনিশ).
steps.content: Nineteen - U-nish (উনিশ). [19] X Research source

steps.title: Twenty - Bish (বিশ).
steps.content: Twenty - Bish (বিশ). The word 'Ku-ree - কুঁড়ি' means twenty as well, but it's less common. [20] X Research source
